[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 239]
Reasoning: **Analyzing the Blind and Joker Strategy**

Okay, so I'm in Ante 7, Round 18. This is "The Flint" blind, meaning my base chips and mult are halved, and I need a total of 70,000 chips. Right now, I only have $38 left. Let's see, my joker situation is as follows:

I've got Droll Joker (Polychrome, +10 Mult if Flush, x1.5 Mult), Ramen (x2 Mult, loses x0.01 per discard), The Tribe (x2 Mult if Flush), Perkeo (Legendary, clones consumable at end of shop) and Stuntman (+250 Chips, -2 hand size). My Flush is already at Level 10, so it's doing pretty good. I had two Jupiters, but I used them up. I'm out of consumables.

The current order of my Jokers is decent: Droll, Ramen, The Tribe, Stuntman. Let's make sure it's the most efficient. I know that the game calculates Jokers in sequence.

I need to see how the Jokers interact with each other. The Flint has halved my Mult to 11. Droll adds +10 Mult, so that brings me to 21. Then, the multiplicative Jokers take effect: Droll's x1.5, Ramen's x2, and Tribe's x2. So, the order: Droll (1), Ramen (2), The Tribe (3).

The math works out to (11 + 10) * 1.5 * 2 * 2 = 126 Mult. Then I add my Chips: 85 (halved) plus Stuntman's 250, so that's 335 chips. Multiplied, the total score per hand is 335 * 126 = 42,210. 

Since Stuntman adds chips, its position in the sequence doesn't matter as much. It's the right order because I need the +Mult and xMult to calculate. I can't level up or add consumables. 

Alright, I've got no other moves. I'm going to commit to this round. 

So the command is `play_round`, and I'm targeting a flush. This should get me about 42,210 chips. Let's play.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

My initial thought was to buy the Celestial Pack hoping for Jupiter (which boosts Flush level), and keep it for Perkeo. However, that wouldn't work; Celestial packs have to be used immediately.
